original_summary: #Person1# and #Person2# want a place near the university and it's better to be quiet. They decide to go to the estate agent to see the houses.

transformed_conversations.personal_summary:
Here's a summary of your interactions with Sarah about finding a place to rent near the university. Back in early June, about two and a half months ago, you and Sarah first discussed what kind of place to look for. You agreed proximity to campus was key so you could sleep in later. A smaller, affordable place was fine, ideally quieter for studying. 

The next day, you went to the estate agent together to see the options. Then in mid-June, Sarah found a promising listing and you scheduled a viewing. When you saw it in person, it looked perfect - a cozy 1-bedroom within walking distance in a peaceful neighborhood. The rent was £550/month, pricier than the £100 you'd originally hoped for, but reasonable split between two. 

After moving forward with the application, there was an anxious two-week wait. Finally, in early July, great news - your application was approved! Over the past month, you've been coordinating with Sarah on moving logistics, buying essentials, and getting settled in before classes start in September. It's been a hectic summer, but you're excited to begin this new chapter in the ideal flat for you both.

messages.content: You: What kind of place shall we rent?
Sarah: It should be close to the university. Neither of us are good at getting up in the mornings and closer it is, the later we can get up.
You: Absolutely. That's the most important thing to take into consideration. I'm not too worried about the size of the flat.
Sarah: Neither am I. So a small place is ok, but we'll get a bigger one if it's not expensive. Do you mind if it's in a noisy area?
You: I don't mind. I'm not a light sleeper, but quieter is better for when we have to study at home.
Sarah: Good point. Ok, let's go to the estate agent and see what they can offer us.
You: Yes, if we're lucky we'll find something in the next few days. I think you had a good idea to start flat hunting early.
Sarah: How much do you think the rent will be?
You: I asked a few people who are already living in places near the university and they said it would cost about one hundred pounds a month.
You: That was a productive meeting with the estate agent yesterday. Sounds like we have a few good options in our price range.
Sarah: Definitely! I'm going to keep an eye on the new listings too in case any other gems pop up.
Sarah: I think I found the perfect place for us! Just posted. 1-bed flat on a quiet street, only a 12 min walk to campus. Want to see pics?
You: Wow that was fast! Yes, send them over. What's the rent?
Sarah: £550/month. I know it's higher than we hoped but it looks so nice and checks all our boxes. Here are the pics! [images]
You: Oh I really like it. Spacious living room, nice natural light. And the location is ideal. I think it's worth a look in person.
Sarah: My thoughts exactly! I'll contact the agent to schedule a viewing ASAP before it gets snatched up.
Sarah: We got the flat!!! Just got the email from the estate agent. Our application was approved!
You: No way!!! That's amazing news! I was so nervous after the viewing, I know they had a lot of interest. We're so lucky.
Sarah: Right? The agent said our application really stood out. I can't believe we got our dream place.
You: When do we get the keys? Need to start planning the move and buying furniture!
Sarah: We can sign the lease and get the keys in 2 weeks, on the 22nd. The place looked move-in ready so we should be able to get settled well before classes start.
You: Fantastic. I'll start looking into hiring movers and vans. Let the flat decorating begin!
